Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: CruisinNurse
Reviews.Content: We stayed over one night prior to our cruise. The outside looked nice, but once stepping inside I knew it would be lacking. The carpets were filthy, and the common areas were very small. For a hotel this size the breakfast area only had 5 or 6 tables. The room itself was big enough, but it had an institutional feeling to it. The beds were small and uncomfortable. The bathroom had hair all over the floor, and the carpet had mystery stains all over it. Breakfast was a joke. They ran out of bowls by 8 am, and cups by 8:30. So by the time my kids went to get breakfast at 8:45 everything was gone even the coffee. Luckily there was a Starbucks around the corner. the location wasn't bad, but in the future I'll pay the extra money to stay at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shakita
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the potential to be a great hotel!!!! Excellent location in the Doral area near the highway and good restaurants. We paid for the cleaning services for our entire stay of 5 days and they only came once. One person at the front desk was very helpful, the rest didn't seem to care much. We had to even go to front desk to pick up our own towels and toilet paper!!!! Terribly embarrassing..... Again we had paid extra to have all this in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own soap !!”
Reviews.Author: healinghart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days at the end of December. The hotel is located on the corner of what appears to be an abandoned strip mall. The person who greeted us at the front desk was rude and seemed as if he was bothered by questions asked regarding hotel policies etc. He was however very quick to tell us that we must throw out our own trash, bring towels to the lobby "if " we wanted new ones and purchase our own soap once the complimentry one was finished. Hotel offered no housekeeping for guest staying less than a week. The pool, and fitness area were runned down and the continental breakfast consisted of dry cereal one or two bagels and juice. The actual room was clean though the towels and linens were hash on the skin. Wifi cost 4.50 and parking was free. Overall this hotel is very very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Super bad cockroaches on the rooms”
Reviews.Author: teckmo
Reviews.Content: I recomend to everybody not to use his hotel because it has cockroaches in the rooms a lot of Them. Besides if You cancel a reservation they charge to you anyway the reservation penalty.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Robledo73
Reviews.Content: It was a work related stay for 15 days and for the price, the location and service is not bad

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: reddiva2u
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right off the freeway (25th ave exit) and is in a very safe and quiet location. It is in a shopping center location but that's because the hotel was built first and the shopping center was built around it (great benefit for visitors). My sisters, boyfriend and I stayed there for two nights prior to our cruise. They have extremely clean rooms, a laundry facility, continental breakfast (cereal, coffee, juice, bagels, oatmeal). Cindy and Rudy our front desk staff were awesome! They catered to our every need, and we had many as it was our first time in Miami. The website (h) I purchased from didn't advertise shuttle service but they do have free shuttle service to/from the airport and a $10-15 shuttle service company that takes you to the Port-of-Miami, they even picked us up from the port when we returned from the cruise (just have to call when you get to baggage/customs). There are several restaurants in the shopping plaza all within walking distance of the hotel. There is a subway, a Starbucks, Checkers, and several local restaurants that serve great spanish/cuban food. There is an Urgent Care, a hair and nail salon which my sisters and I used the morning of our cruise. Across the street there is another shopping plaza I explored also within walking distance. They have several shops and even an awesome bakery that delivers out-of-state. Located on 87th ave. is Walmart, Hooters and several banks. On 107th ave barely a drive at all is the Dolphin Mall with many more shops. Hotel is in a great location! This hotel is rated 2.5 stars but gave us 5 star treatment! Thank You Extended Stay Deluxe Miami Doral!

Reviews.Title: “SMELLED LIKE A GARBAGE CAN”
Reviews.Author: bandittraveler
Reviews.Content: The entrance to the hotel is in a small plaza and there is no sign out front so we missed the turn off and had to go back on the turnpike. When we arrived the whole building smelled of rotting garbage because maid service is an extra charge and when your garbage can is full you toss your trash in the trash room and it stays there until they feel like emptying it. Windows have no screens and are so dirty you cannot see out of them. Hotel is near airport and of course noisy which is understandable but the smell is not. Spend your money elsewhere it is not that convienent to the airport as it leads you to believe.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: KamalTiwari
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for money. The rooms are really spacious and the quality of appliances and other things in the room is really amazing. The kitchen is very clean and well maintained. All the appliances were clean and functional and the 4 top stove was really spacious. The room has plenty of empty space and the bed, linen, bathrooms are all of excellent quality. They also provide breakfast in mornings but have the same menu everyday. They have a swimming pool and gym but I hardly used them. Overall we found this hotel and excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: brewerfan2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on Sunday Feb. 21st. We were only staying here before cruising out of the Port the next day. There were about 10 restaurants within a two block walk from the hotel, but 8 of them were closed on Sunday. A horrible location as you cannot access the hotel from the main street, but you need to drive into the strip mall a block before the address and drive behind it to get there. There was a full kitchen in the room which we did not use and a basic 27 inch TV. Excellent bed and shower and the Continental breakfast was packaged food with coffee and juice. If you are a business traveler this place would be perfect. A no frills but functional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If ants aren't a problem to you....”
Reviews.Author: kath052983
Reviews.Content: ....then good bargain. This hotel is no more than a 2 star (if that). Ants were crawling everywhere in the bathroom!!! TV did not work, and called the front desk for assistance. Lady said that she would call back to tell me when I can pick up new remote. Over an hour later, went to front desk and she said she forgot my room number. Other than that....would only recommend staying for one night. Two nights okay if not in your room the whole time. Painfully slow internet service in Business Center.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with value and amenities”
Reviews.Author: MauiBodyboarder
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accomodating and friendly. The rooms are very large compared to a normal hotel. It's nice to have a kitchen as well. It's a little noisy on the back side but not enough to be an issue unless you are very sensitive to noise. Everything was so good, I'll point out the only negatives just in case it's an issue. The particular room we were in had 2 beds. There is no door between the beds and the sink area so if anyone gets up and turns on the light or washes up, it can awaken others. The toilet and shower of course are in their own room. A positive part of our room is that the area that has the kitchen and "living room." is a ways away from the bedroom which gives great privacy. The included breakfast was nothing special but it was very nice to have. Fruit and fruit juice were provided in addition to other breakfast items. I'm a critical consumer and I would be glad to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: BigP
Reviews.Content: I never cease being amazed at the often terribly negative reviews on Trip Advisor about hotels/motels where my wife and I have stayed and, more often than not, rated above average if not superior. The Extended Stay Deluxe in Doral (Miami International Airport) is a perfect example of such a site. A number of reviewers have panned this site for any number of reasons but though it is easy to agree with one recent writer that the Extended Stay may not be "deluxe," it is easily one of the best in its chain (and we have stayed in more than dozen across the United States) and a great place to stay when stopping in the Miami International Airport area. My wife and I just returned after spending eight days at the Extended Stay Deluxe while visiting Miami. We chose that specific hotel because of its central location, its relatively easy on and off relation to nearby freeways and toll roads, its reasonable rates (no one who has ever booked a room in south Florida in January and can possibly believe that they can find a full-sized, king-bedded suite with a full kitchen for less than $80 a night, which we did here, is living in another universe), and, not insignificantly, the motel's complimentary breakfast which, if in no way unique, not only saves one from worrying about either making one's own breakfast or going out to look for something off-site. The Extended Stay offers a comfortable place to stay and, ultimately, that's what a motel room is all about. But let's be clear: The Extended Stay is also in no way a resort hotel. The lobby, the breakfast room, and, indeed, the suites themselves are, at best, utilitarian. Rooms are cleaned only once a week and parking can be, on some evenings anyway, "tight." There are, as others have noted, a few places to eat and/or shop in the immediate area but, realistically, a car is necessary to access even something is simple as a Walmart store which is located about two miles away from the motel. Traffic both in the morning and afternoon can be overwhelming and it makes getting to and from motel, which is "hidden" somewhat behind a small strip mall, a real challenge at times. Are there larger (and certainly far more expensive) hotels in the area? Absolutely. Most offer far more amenities than does the ESD. If anyone wants elegant in-house "pluses" such as chocolates on the pillow at night, then one should never consider any Extended Stay motel. If, on the other hand, a nice stay for the money in a clean and well-kept-up establishment in the Miami-Doral area is desirable, one ought look no further than here. Ratings are always subjective. Though given Trip Advisor's scale, a "4" is the most realistic one available, the Extended Stay Deluxe is probably closer to a 3.75. That, of course, is in no way bad. As long as a person is interested in a good night's stay, and apparently any number of pilots who we saw every day that we were at the hotel wanted just that, a 3.75 or even a 4 is more than good enough. My wife and I were in no way unhappy that we decided on the ESD and, were we ever to come back in the area, we'd make new reservations without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...totally doable”
Reviews.Author: yenger
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on border line crappy part of Miami. If you get in late a cab ride is around $20 or $25 with tip. The staff was very friendly, room was clean, but if you choose to eat in the room you need to put your leftovers in the refrigerator or dispose right away. The room will be over whelmed with ants or spiders if you don't remove the leftovers. I only stayed two nights, before leaving. Doable if you're staying for a short period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean - good servicee - free parking”
Reviews.Author: softerik
Reviews.Content: Everything was great at this Hotel. The guy at the desk was very friendly when we check-in - i ask im for wifi internet service and he give us without a charge - when we go in the room,there were a cigarette smoke smell, i call the desk and they excuse and give us another room, this one was ok! Each morning we took our free breakfast (complimentary breakfast), bagel and cream cheese + fresh fruit and yogurt and was quite good !! - the kitchen in the room was very helpful for us - If you go to Miami almost all Hotel charge for parking, us was free - All in all was a good Hotel so i recommend for business traveler

Reviews.Title: “Good solid clean hotel next to airport”
Reviews.Author: snippet_sf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel my last night in Miami so I could be close to the airport for my flight home the next day. Extended Stay hotels are a mid range chain of hotels that cater to business travelers. The Miami-Doral hotel is just what I expected. Clean, but nondescript bathroom, good solid furniture with just a little flair and a kitchenette that works well for one to two people. Think â€œclean, serviceable, utilitarianâ€� and you get the picture. I chose this hotel after a lot of research because I found that the majority of hotels at this price range in Miami are nasty, bed bug infested dumps with unscrupulous people running them (I originally planned to stay in South Beach or closer to downtown). If you â€˜ve done much research on Trip Advisor so far, you will have discovered this as well. I asked a friend who lived in Miami for many years about the hotel situation and she confirmed that what Iâ€™ve discovered is true. She said that a lot of people pass through Miami and the attitude of many hotel owners is â€œget the money and the customer/service be damned.â€� I guess the waves of people just keep coming and coming no matter how bad it is. Good for the hotel owners, bad for us travelers. In the end, I selected the Extended Stay and was delighted that I had. It was very clean, the people at the front desk were pleasant, it was very close to the airport (sound proof - no noise from the planes), and had a coffee/cereal/muffin breakfast selection in the lobby. If I am ever in Miami again I will stay here again. Two notes: 1) The hotel is in a weird spot. It is not directly on the street. Instead, it is pushed back behind and next to a strip mall. I drove by a few times (at night) looking at the address over and over before I finally drove into the strip mall and found the hotel parking lot and entrance. 2) if you have a rental car to return to the airport give yourself extra time. Finding the car rental return area is an absolute NIGHTMARE! Lousy and confusing signs, multiple turns that make no sense, etc. I barely made my flight!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mlj1010
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Miami. I stayed in this hotel unknowing anything about it the first time. When I returned I did not hesitate to make my reservations with this hotel. The employees are very friendly and the rooms are clean. It is also a quiet place. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea32
Reviews.Content: The room was only cleaned once during a one week stay, and even then the dishes were not cleaned. The staff were uninformed and unhelpful - they did not have change for the laundry or have extra towels/bedsheets when required. For one breakfast, scheduled to finish service at 9:30, I called at 9:35 and was told that my baby and I could not have any of the food offered...after a 5 minute delay past 9:30! The shuttle service is very slow... Do not book at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, clean accommodation close to MIA. Airport transfer starts 7AM”
Reviews.Author: ChristyAtom
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel close to the airport. Had to call and then wait thirty five minutes for the transfer on arrival at MIA; still, that wasn't a huge problem. Only real problem was that the airport transfer doesn't start until 7AM. Taxi was $22. Would definitely use as an airport hotel again if my flight left after 9:00AM, otherwise would probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Travelfevermama
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation to the keys and Miami area. The hotel was convenient to the highway, clean and tastefully decorated. The staff was really helpful. The kitchen in the suite really made it helpful for a family of 5, and the price was excellent for this added benefit. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again. It was a little close to the airport, so we heard the jets while we were trying to fall asleep the first night. By the 2nd night, we were not bothered by them at all. If we return to the area in the future, we will definitely consider staying here again. I am extremely picky when it comes to booking a hotel and we were pleasantly surprised and pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, If You Like Doing Your Own Room Service”
Reviews.Author: ROWM2002
Reviews.Content: We statyed at this hotel four nights. The staff was very friendly. Room was clean. However, when I booked I didn't realize I had to do my own housekeeping or pay for housekeeping services. The only other draw back was that they charged my credit card up front, even though I told them I wanted to pay cash. There were ants in the kitchen one of the days, but otherwise the stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: FBARNWArkansas
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel!! The location was perfect and the customer service was awesome! My room was very comfortable and clean and above all quiet, despite being so close to the airport. There were a few great places to eat lunch and dinner just a short walk from the lobby...very convenient! I will absolutely stay here each and every time I am in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly rooms, loud traffic, less than scenic area...but convenient and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: ChaseAustinTX
Reviews.Content: Our room was a large suite and that was nice, but we had several problems. First, the hotel staff gave us bad directions that led to an additional 10 minute delay arriving. Second the only rooms the hotel offered that are smoke-free are handicapped. They need to get with the times! And the room we settled on smelled like Chinese food. (So we swapped stale cigarettes for stale Chinese.) Also, the noise from the Palmetto expressway adjacent and a nearby motorcyclist party was a bit annoying. But the price was something like $100 a night with tax etc, so that's pretty cheap for Miami. And the room was definitely spacious and clean and close to the airport, which is what we wanted (to catch an early morning flight out). Plus they do have computers with internet access downstairs if you need them which I thought was cool. So I'm not sure we could have done much better for a cheap place to crash near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A great price and a HUGE room”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyScotsman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Miami for 2 days just before going on a cruise. Decided on the Extended Stay at Doral for its location (close to the airport and the main malls). The price was excellent compared with other hotels in Miami. Getting to the hotel was not straighforward, the entrance is at the back of a coffee shop and some other shops, the sat-nav struggled at the end. Checking in was pleasant, we had a room on the Freeway side which was a little noisy, but did not disturb us any. There is plenty of parking. The room was HUGE, with two queen beds, seperate sitting area with a two seater sofa, recliner chair and desk. The kitchen was all full sze appliances. A very large fridge, and all the pots, pans and plates you could ever need. The bathroom was also large with unlimited hot water. The aircon worked a treat both cold and hot. The free breakfast was basic, but in unlimited supplies. The receptionist was very good, when i asked the cost of the Wireless Internet, it was normally $4.95 per stay but he gave us it for free. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a cheap, clean, large hotel for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: CnsteFr
Reviews.Content: Suites have all you need. Kitchen, bathroom, desk, lounge area, internet connection, TV. Staff are friendly and bilingual (Spanish, English) like in most places in Miami. The place was very clean. One small problem is finding it as it's not too visible from the road: you need to go into the parking area of the shopping complex next door to get into the hotel parking. It's the large building quite far back off the street. 5 mins drive to Miami International Airport (without traffic).

Reviews.Title: “A fine option if you have business at the airport”
Reviews.Author: tomcat33333
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Priceline and got a very good rate. Not knowing anything about it, we were somewhat worried about the quality we would find when we arrived. No worries! It was safe, clean and reasonably comfortable. Our room was very clean, with a good bathroom and a bed that was on the firm side, but fine just the same. Everything worked, including all parts of the mini kitchen. I don't think I'd want to try more than the basics in it ("mini" is the right description), but it more than met our needs for an overnight stay. The place is located a relatively short distance from the hotel. We were able to get to it from our car rental agency without a hitch, in the dark and without any previosu knowledge of the area. Front desk people could have been a bit more helpful with directions, but overall were fine. Stay an an ESA if you can get a bargain rate, like the $50 or so we paid. There are better alternatives at higher price points, but this one's not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Alfred15
Reviews.Content: great place to stay, very clean and we were able to leave car there and continue to airport using there free service to and from airport, They have a nice continetal free breakfast including great coffeeThere is a good pizza place within walking distance called Marios bakery. and chicken place also. Great check in very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: bridgetlynn
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I got to our room! I am a clean freak, but this room was actually up to my standards. Only one problem, the towels. On the first day, I went to take a shower and the towels had hairs all over them. Gross. So we got new towels and they were fine, but on about 2 or 3 other days of our 8 day stay we also had hairs on the towels... I'm assuming (and hoping) that it's just the cleaning ladies hairs falling onto the towels, because everything else about the room seemed clean. But this hotel is very nice for the price. The decor (couch, curtains, paint, etc.) was all very nice and updated just as the website described. The bathroom had a nice big closet and vanity area that I loved (not enough hangers though). And it was great to have a full kitchen (stove, oven, microwave, fridge, sink, and dishes) And the laundry room was great too, did laundry 3 times (told you I was a clean freak lol). The fitness center only had a couple treadmills and bikes... nothing but cardio... The pool looked nice and clean from afar, but I didn't go close to it... I would definitely stay here again as long as I bring my own towels or the cleaning staff starts wearing hair nets, but I will probably just bring a couple of my own towels since there are good laundry facilities. Another pleasant surprise was that the wireless internet service was only $5 for the whole week! I thought I had read somewhere that it was $5 per day, so that was nice! It was also nice that there was a Subway and a place called Chicken Grill within walking distance... other than that you'd need a car or a cab to get to a grocery or drug store... but we had a car so it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Studio Plus during the Christmas holidays. We were there for about 8 days. The rooms are comfortable, one king size bed with a sofa couch. Modern and clean. The kitchen area is great, With a 4-burner stove, microwave, full-size fridge and plenty of cabinet space. I was actually able to put together a full dinner on Christmas day. There is a pool, although it is rather small and not designed for play with children. On-site laundry facility and a little workout room with a couple treadmills and a bike. Perfect for business trips or vacation. I was very happy with our stay there and would stay again. We are a military family, and with a discount only paid about $57 a night, during Miami's peak season. The staff was helpful. There isn't a restaurant in the complex, but the surrounding area is full of fast food and restaurant eateries. Right off the Palmetto Expressway so it is convienent to everything. Overall, great location, we loved it. The only drawback for us was the small pool. We would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Extended Stay Deluxe Miami - Airport - Doral
HotelInfo.Address: 7750 NW 25th Street, Miami, FL 33122
